newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Rouble steady amid unchanged central bank rates.
newsitem.headline: Rouble steady amid unchanged central bank rates.

text.p: The rouble was little changed in calm trading on Thursday and dealers cited the central bank's exchange rates, unchanged since Tuesday, as the main stabilising factor.
The central bank said it had set 5,429/5,439 as its bid and offer rates against the dollar on Thursday. the same on Tuesday and Wednesday.
"It is the third day the central bank has been demonstrating it is sure of keeping the rouble rate," Inkombank chief dealer Vladimir Kudryavtsev said.
"Those banks who are still on the market are coming to the conlusion dollar buying is not attractive," he added.
Roubles for today settlement were quoted at 5,437-40 per dollar, the same as in early trading and late on Wednesday. Tomorrow roubles edged down to 5,438-41 per dollar from yesterday's late 5,437-40.
Overnight rouble credits yielded 15-30 percent compared with Wednesday's late 5-10 percent.
Dealers said the central bank could be making dollar investment less attractive to increase demand on the government bond market.
They forecast the rouble's slow decline of one to three points a day was likely to resume on Friday or early next week.
